title: separate email windows now have all the same title
content:
I use the Reading & Display setting "Open messages in a new message window". To view the list of open windows I have used the Window tab on the system toolbar (the toolbar at the very top of the desktop I am working in; MacBook Pro). This would normally provide a list of the windows with their individual messages by subject. Since the recent major upgrade the window view tab shows messages with the identical title: "Mozilla Thunderbird". Therefore I now have to click each one to figure out which email I want to bring to the front which is a pain when I'm synthesizing information from across multiple emails (why I use the "open in new message window" in the first place). I've attached a screen shot.

I would appreciate any pointers on anything that I can do to change this back to a more informative list of open windows - or at least let me know that this is a known issue and is being worked on.

Thanks!

title: Thunderbird not loading filters
content:
A few days ago I installed Thunderbird, and once I got it working I set a bunch of filters. I just checked my email today through Thunderbird, and none of the filters I set are showing up. I was able to locate three versions of my msgFilterRules.dat file (one in my local folder, one in my (obsolete) pop folder, and one in my imap folder)

My guess is that one of them has my filters, but got saved in the wrong place or something, and now my filters won't appear. I could be wrong about that, I but don't know how to check which one might have my filters are there, or import them into my settings.

If I can't get my filters back, though, how would I go about preserving them? It's very frustrating that they disappeared, and I don't want that to happen again.
